titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Frederick W. Knipe collection FA029

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-01 01:28:15 -0500.

physdesc.extent: 17 reels of film and photographs. 15 cubic feet is just a placeholder until extent can be determined.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection, or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Frederick W. Knipe deposited his collection with the Rockefeller Foundation Archives in June 1969.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Important subjects in this collection include: malaria control, drainage of mosquito breeding, development and use of spraying equipment for insecticides.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frederick W. Knipe was born in 1893 in Hughesville, Pennsylvania. Attending Penn State from 1913-1917 and Iowa State College from 1919-1920, he studied agricultural engineering and secured a license as a drainage and irrigation engineer. From 1920-1930, Mr. Knipe was Assistant Professor of Engineering at Connecticut Agricultural College and Consulting Engineer for the Raymond Keeler Contracting Company.

Joining the International Health Division in 1930, Mr. Knipe took part in the Rockefeller Foundation's anti-malaria campaigns. From 1930-1937, he worked in Bulgaria and Albania. Transferred to Madras State, India in 1937, he participated in the first area-wide campaigns using insecticide effectively against the adult female mosquito. He remained in India until 1942, when he was attached to the U. S. Army malaria control project in Florida. In Rome in 1944, he served as advisor on malaria control for the Army of Occupation; he then joined the Sardinian Project in 1946. Mr. Knipe was assigned to the Malaria Institute of India in 1952, where he taught the use of equipment for malaria control. He retired from the Rockefeller Foundation in 1958.

A major professional interest of Mr. Knipe's had always been an efficient and effective sprayer for the insecticide. While in Italy he designed and built sprayers and then in India worked on perfecting a portable sprayer. There they made their own equipment to manufacture the insecticide, made their own sprayers, and assembled their own power equipment to activate the sprayers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lagoons, canals, construction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lagoons, bridges, construction, canals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Canals, irrigation, agriculture, dams, construction.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Frederick Knipe was a staff member of the International Health Division of the Rockefeller Foundation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The RAC has several silent films from the 1930s about the Tirana River Project in Albania and the efforts to combat malaria throughout the Balkans and in India.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 2 business days, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may be restricted from access at the discretion of RAC.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage from malaria efforts in Albania (1930-1937), Durazzo (1930-1932), and Tirana (1933-1935). Scenes of drainage project, salinification of lagoon, killing mosquitoes with salt, Dr. Lewis Hackett, Knipe opening a dike.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1932 footage of the lagoon in Porto Romano: automatic tide gates, canal entrance; also the lab and headquarters at Tirana.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of canal construction and usage.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tirana River Project: footage of Isuurush Canal and Siphon Dam on the Llana River.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tirana River Project: Dr. Russell and Dr. G.K. Strode opening the canal and the Calco irrigation gate, the first in Albania.

accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tirana River Project: finishing construction of the dam and scenes of the dam in action during a flood.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black and white, 15 minutes 30 seconds

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of the countryside, market day, gypsies dancing at Petrich, washing at a hot water spring, a canal; Dr. Ralph Collins measuring water.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1930 footage of the main canal being inspected by Knipe and Dr. G.K. Strode.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scenes in Luka and Topolnitza: irrigating for corn, building dams, sickling hay.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of canal construction in Madras State (now Tamil Nadu): mixing plaster by foot, removing earth and stumps; dedication of the Pattukkottai scheme by Dr. Rojan.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of efforts to kill mosquitoes; pyrethrum spray gun, spraying village houses and rice nurseries.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typical scene of mosquito treatments; footage of Sukkur Barrage, largest in India.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1942-1944 officer training film from World War II: draining mosquito breeding areas, ditch blasting, stumpage.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1930-1932 footage from tour of Sardinia for group, including Dr. Rollo Hill, Lewis Hackett, Dr. Wilson G. Smillie, and Fred Knipe. Siniscola tour, IHD conference, visit to Sorrento, Italy. Also includes Dr. F.F. Russell, Dr. Rollo Hill, Dr. Marshall Balfour, Dr. Ralph Collins, Dr. Elizabeth Crowell, and engineer Dan Wright.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introduction to Sardinia: footage of villages, coastline, aqueduct ceremony, water wheel powered by a donkey, local life.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of the Oliena district, explosives used on drainage projects, clearing riverbeds, curing tobacco, construction on canals.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access copy currently unavailable. Please contact an RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Footage of efforts against malaria: insecticide development in factories, spraying with helicopters, burning dry vegetation to reveal breeding areas.
